document_data.name: Dawnfire
document_data.mainbody: '''Dawnfire''' was the ancient capital of the kingdom ruled by the [[gold dragon]] King [[Orchtrien]] by the end of the [[Time of Dragons]].
document_data.Description: The city was built as a single large castle. A wonder to the eye, the city seemed to be hewn from the top of its mountaintop resting place rather than being built there; the entire place was ornamented tastefully, and caught the eye in an especially fetching way at dawnbreak.

Geography.Geographical Features:
There was an Elf Quarter in Dawnfire, a grove of [[oak]] and [[shadowtop]] trees transplanted from old forests. One of them had a spiral staircase along its trunk.

Orchtrien's personal palace was a hive-like structure with a great door, that had a smaller door on the right doorblade for human-sized guests. The southern towers had a surrounding garden, that smelled of [[brunfelsia]].{{cite book/Realms of the Elves/Traitors|37-38}} Another tower, where he watched over things, was surrounded by greenery, which included [[pine]] trees, mutated by magical experiments so that their needles clinked with a metallic sound in the wind, and some of the flowers were pale, fleshy, with lidless eyes in their centers. The tower had illusory ceilings in the center of its one-room floors, to allow for a wyrm's ease of movement.{{cite book/Realms of the Elves/Traitors|40-42}}
Geography.Defenses: There were a number of [[half-dragon]] soldiers in the city, comprising Orchtrien's personal guard.{{cite book/Realms of the Elves/Traitors|69-70}}

document_data.Government: King [[Orchtrien]] had deputies, two of which were [[Maldur Breakstone]] and [[Rhespen Ash]].
document_data.History: In {{Yearlink|-25000}}, Orchtrien destroyed large portions of the city, including the royal keep and fortress, during the first [[Rage of Dragons]].<ref>
